title: Are there other websites like Google Trends? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are two types of Google Trends alternatives. The first do not rely on the data collected by the Google search engine and the second ones do. Major search engines like Baidu in China, Yandex in Russia, Bing/Yahoo offer their own services similar to Google Trends. These are free to use, to my knowledge. Bing’s service is integrated into Excel as an Add On. It is called Bing Ads Intelligence. I think the data from yahoo is also integrated in it. I couldn’t find Yahoo’s version. Earlier, before 2012, yahoo had a service called Clue, which offered similar results like Google Trends. After the contract with Bing, I think yahoo has decided to concentrate their focus on other projects, but provide their search volume data to Bing Ads Intelligence. Baidu’s service is https://index.baidu.com/ . To try it out, one needs a phone nr from China. Yandex alternative to Google Trends is https://wordstat.yandex.com/. There are other search engines like Naver from South Korea, ask, aol. I don’t know whether they have similar services like Google Trends. There are also sites like semrush, moz, serpstat, keywordtool, etc.. I think they collect data from big search engines like google, amazon, bing, etc. and try to gain insight into the data for their customers, website administrators.
I use Let the web help.  It doesn't show the data and statistics for keywords, but does show similar search terms through various engines.

Not exactly. Bing has a trends summary for the year: Bing Trends 2015. Reddit has trending topics: Trending Reddits • /r/TrendingReddits. Facebook also has rough trends: Trends | Facebook Newsroom. But, bottom line, very few companies have the breadth of data of Google to analyze.
Here’s a gig where you can get a keyword research including google trends data: https://www.fiverr.com/seo__reports/keyword-research-google-trends
